Bastać: Policija najnormalnije ušla u prostorije opštine, gledaju predmete a mene nisu tražili

05 Nov 2019, 12:40

 Predsednik opštine Stari grad Marko Bastać potvrdio je da su pripadnici MUP-a danas ušli u prostorije te beogradske opštine i da "gledaju predmete" ali je i dodao da ne zna "na osnovu čega su došli".Bastać je agenciji Beta rekao da policajci sa njim nisu komunicirali jer u to vreme nije bio u opštinskim prostorijama."Nema ničeg spornog oko toga. Ljudi su ušli najnormalnije, legitimisali su se i gledaju predmete. Nisam bio tamo pa ne mogu da komentarišem šta gledaju, ali mene nisu tražili", rekao je Bastać koji je i predsednik beogradskog odbora Stranke slobode i pravde.On je dodao da ne zna da li su policajci došli po nalogu tužilaštva a u vezi sa navodima bivšeg funkcionera opštine Stari grad Lazara Lešnjaka o korupciji u toj beogradskoj opštini.Ministarstvo unutrašnjih poslova potvrdilo je ranije danas da su pripadnici policije ušli u zgradu beogradske opštine Stari grad kako bi prikupili dokumentaciju povodom istrage o mogućim zloupotrebama u toj opštini.Kako se navodi, policija je u zgradu opštine ušla po nalogu Višeg javnog tužilaštva.MUP je podsetio da Više javno tužilaštvo u Beogradu vodi predistražni postupak povodom navoda bivšeg funkcionera opštine Stari grad Lazara Lešnjaka o korupciji u toj beogradskoj opštini.Lešnjak je optužio svog kuma i predsednika te opštine Marka Bastaća da je uzimao novac od nelegalnih investitora i da ga je Bastać jednom prilikom fizički maltretirao celu noć kada je propustio da mu donese jedan koverat sa novcem.

Bastac: The police entered the municipal premises most abnormally, looking at objects and not looking for me

05 Nov 2019, 12:40

The Mayor of Stari grad, Marko Bastac, confirmed that MUP members entered the premises of that Belgrade municipality today and that they "look at the objects", but added that he did not know "on what basis they came." Bastac told Beta police that they didn't communicate to him because he was not in municipal premises at the time. "There is nothing in dispute about this. People came in the most insane, they legitimized themselves and they look at objects. I wasn't there so I can't comment on what they were looking at, but they didn't ask me," is Bastac, who is also chairman of the Belgrade committee of the Party for Freedom and Justice.He added that he did not know whether the police officers came at the behest of the prosecution in connection with allegations of corruption by the former Stari Grad municipality official Lazar Lešnjak in the Belgrade municipality. earlier today that members of the police entered a building in Belgrade's Stari grad municipality to collect documentation regarding an investigation into possible abuse in that municipality.K If alleged, police entered the municipality building at the behest of the Higher Public Prosecutor's Office. The MUP reminded that the Higher Public Prosecutor's Office in Belgrade is conducting pre-investigative proceedings over allegations of corruption by the former Stari Grad municipality official Lazar Lesnjak in his Belgrade municipality. the mayor of that municipality, Marko Bastac, that he took money from illegal investors and that on one occasion Bastac physically abused him all night when he failed to bring him an envelope with money.
